intro: Bupleurum angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf threadleaf, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, fern-like leaves that are typically narrow and elongated. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Bupleurum angustissimum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
